title: explain tribunal in your Terms of Service please
body: 2.1.3. The Tribunal®. The Tribunal® system allows our community of users to police the compliance of other users with the “Summoner’s Code,” which outlines the principles of ideal game play behavior, as well as with our other policies. Community members, including you, may submit descriptions of activity and actions of certain users within the Game, and collectively determine if that particular user was in compliance with our policies. If The Tribunal determines, in its sole discretion, that you have violated one of our policies, we may suspend or terminate your account on behalf of the community.

replies.body:
What.

The tribunal has not existed for years.

>2.1.3. The Tribunal®. The Tribunal® does not exist anymore.

FTF...R?

The Tribunal doesn't exist, so that specific part of the agreement is (most likely) null and void (everything else is still in full effect, though; refer to section 16.10 [scroll to the bottom]). It's just a remnant of when the Tribunal was actually being used, and there are a few possible reasons as to why it would still be in the ToU, such as being overlooked as the ToU is updated, or perhaps Riot is still exploring ways to bring the Tribunal back and doesn't want to cut that out yet.
that's not what the terms of service just said. i like to read before i accept :)
